subject: Philosophy
title: Effective Altruism
description: A quick win: understand Effective Altruism.

hook.text: Peter Singer asked: if a child is drowning and you can save them, are you obligated to act?

buildup.text: Most people say yes. Singer then asked: what about children dying of poverty far away?

discovery.text: Effective altruism applies utilitarian logic: donate where each dollar saves the most lives.

twist.text: Critics say it turns morality into cold math. Should you skip your friend's birthday to donate more?

climax.text: EA has moved billions toward global health, but the tension between logic and humanity remains.

punchline.text: Doing the most good is harder than doing good.

quiz.question: What does effective altruism prioritize?
options: Directing resources where they do the most measurable good
